cyclone.name: DORIAN
cyclone.current_location: about 135 miles ESE of Jacksonville, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: tracking north then north-northeast parallel to the Georgia coast toward the South Carolina/North Carolina coasts
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the central South Carolina coast (around Charleston)

weather_observation.watch_coast: North of Ponte Vedra Beach FL to Savannah River
weather_observation.warning_coast: Sebastian Inlet FL to Savannah River (tropical-storm warning), Hurricane warning begins just north of Savannah River
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida east coast, the entire Georgia coast, and South Carolina through North Carolina coasts
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (34–50 kt) are very likely; low (≈26%) but non-negligible chance of 50-kt winds at the port. Hurricane-force winds unlikely but cannot be ruled out if the center wobbles west.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Storm surge of 3–5 ft possible in the Savannah River entrance and adjacent coastline, especially at high tide, with large, battering waves.
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–6 inches of rain with isolated amounts to 9 inches near the Georgia coast; flash flooding possible.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes along the immediate Georgia coast; dangerous surf and rip currents; river/estuary flooding that can disrupt terminal access roads and rail lines.
